recommendations: Stuart Jackson
Learning, Product, and UX Design
September 21, 2017, Stuart worked with Steven in different groups

Steven is the real deal. Time and again I saw him show leadership, poise, and conviction in his work, despite pressure. He showed initiative, tenacity, and consistency in every project he led. The average person is content to rest on his laurels--not Steven. He is a true lifelong learner, always expanding his skills and abilities through training and experience, always pushing to do things better and more efficiently. That kind of drive is what inspires and motivates those around him.

Rick Rowen
Sr Merchandise Financial Planning Analyst at PetSmart
September 17, 2017, Rick worked with Steven in the same group

Rick and I worked together at O'Reilly Auto Parts. As a coworker, he easily passes the test of being someone who others like to work with. Rick is easy to get along with, and always had a great attitude. On the professional side, Rick has always been committed to working hard, and staying up to date in his career field. To keep everyone engaged he would often share articles, books, or go over trends that he had learned, and how they would apply to the business. I would strongly recommend Rick Rowen, as you will surely gain a great employee.

David ODey
UX Prototyper at Pearson
October 26, 2015, Steven reported directly to David

If you are looking to bring your application a step into the future, then I would highly recommend David. I worked under David as a Sr. UI/UX Developer for the O’Reilly Auto Parts B2B e-commerce site First Call Online. During this time, he successfully took an outdated design process and created a smooth asset-producing machine. His skills in responsive web design and modern design trends have significantly benefited O’Reilly. As a leader he was able to easily adjust his leadership style to match the needs of those under him. David’s approach of constantly evaluating the needs of his team members in return led to more productive employees making great products.

summary: I learned the foundation of great leadership through leading communications and design teams where I exercise ethical leadership and produce results through creating productive team members. My career has been very diverse and well-rounded. I’ve started a corporation, worked for an investor-backed startup, and I have also worked for a Fortune 500 company designing and developing an e-commerce site that generated nearly half a billion dollars annually. Through the years I have gained technical expertise in the fields of graphic information technology, user interface design, user experience design, web development, strategic decision making, and risk management.
